beforeCommit.message:
DHFPROD-3577: Global sort based on sortable properties

Adding tests

afterCommit.message:
DHFPROD-3577: Global sort based on sortable properties

Adding tests

nodes.bodyText:
Are there tests for this line of code? This seems brittle - what if the the namespace prefix is "aes"? Then an occurrence of "aes:" would end up as "a*:", which I believe will fail.
I recommend putting the conversion of a property path into a constraint name into a separate non-private function and writing unit tests for that. That will both verify and document the behavior of the function.

We only need a single operator with a name of "sort". Then, for every sortable property, we have two states - "(propertyName)Ascending" and "(propertyName)Descending".
I believe you can get away with "propertyName" and not property path because for 5.3.0, we're only supporting sorting on top-level properties. Thus, we do not need to worry about property paths (we may never have to).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -235,6 +237,28 @@ declare %private function hent:fix-options-exp($nodes as node()*, $sortable-prop
       default return $n
 };
 
+declare %private function hent:add-sort-operators-to-search-options($sortable-properties as map:map)
+{
+  let $sort-operators :=
+    for $property-path in map:keys($sortable-properties)
+      let $property-path := fn:replace($property-path, "es:", "*:")
+      let $constraint-name := fn:concat("sort", xdmp:initcap(fn:tokenize($property-path, "/")[last()]))
+      return
+        <search:operator name="{$constraint-name}">

nodes.bodyText: Also, see my comment below - I don't think we need property paths here, because for 5.3.0, we're only supporting sorting on top-level properties. Thus, a simple property name will suffice. And I don't think that should have a namespace prefix in it, in which case there's no need to replace "es:".

I believe we need two kinds of tests in this class:

One or more tests that verify that the correct "criteria" is constructed based on the SortOrder objects in the SearchQuery
A test that verifies that inserts two customer entity instances and verifies that sorting on a property in ascending and then descending order returns the 2 instances in the correct order.

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-3577: Global sort based on sortable properties

nodes.bodyText: This is fine to keep here - 5626 will turns this into "/:envelope/:instance/:Book/:title", just an FYI.
I am hoping 5626 removes the need for this, as path expressions will now always have "/*:" in them instead of "/es:", but I'm not 100% sure of that yet.
Are these empty arrays intentionally here to clear out the indexes?
